channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: A strong earthquake rocks Taiwan, collapsing buildings and causing a tsunami
item.description: Taiwan's earthquake monitoring agency gave the magnitude as 7.2. The earthquake collapsed buildings in a southern city and created a tsunami that washed ashore on southern Japanese islands.
item.content:encoded: Taiwan's earthquake monitoring agency gave the magnitude as 7.2. The earthquake collapsed buildings in a southern city and created a tsunami that washed ashore on southern Japanese islands.

item.title: Caitlin Clark once dreamed of going to UConn. Now, she'll face them in the Final Four
item.description: Clark's freshman year at Iowa ended with a Sweet 16 loss to UConn. Now, with her aim on Iowa's first-ever championship to cap off her final season, a Final Four win over the Huskies must come first.
item.content:encoded:
Clark's freshman year at Iowa ended with a Sweet 16 loss to UConn. Now, with her aim on Iowa's first-ever championship to cap off her final season, a Final Four win over the Huskies must come first.

(Image credit: Sarah Stier)
item.dc:creator: Becky Sullivan

item.title: 'SCTV' star and comedian Joe Flaherty dies at 82
item.description: The Emmy winner starred with John Candy and Catherine O'Hara in "SCTV,″ about a fictional TV station. Flaherty's characters included network boss Guy Caballero and the vampiric TV host Count Floyd.
item.content:encoded:
The Emmy winner starred with John Candy and Catherine O'Hara in "SCTV,″ about a fictional TV station. Flaherty's characters included network boss Guy Caballero and the vampiric TV host Count Floyd.

(Image credit: E Pablo Kosmicki)

item.title: World Central Kitchen, led by a humanitarian chef, has fed crisis zones for years
item.description: World Central Kitchen has long brought food to war zones and disaster areas around the world. The deaths of seven of its workers in Gaza come on top of the loss of six workers in Ukraine.
item.content:encoded:
World Central Kitchen has long brought food to war zones and disaster areas around the world. The deaths of seven of its workers in Gaza come on top of the loss of six workers in Ukraine.

(Image credit: Efrem Lukatsky)
item.dc:creator: Rachel Treisman

item.title: Biden and China's Xi make first contact since November with a 'check-in' call
item.description: Tuesday's call between the two leaders followed through on a pledge they made in November for more frequent contact to try to help stabilize the U.S.-China relationship.
item.content:encoded: Tuesday's call between the two leaders followed through on a pledge they made in November for more frequent contact to try to help stabilize the U.S.-China relationship.
item.dc:creator: John Ruwitch

item.title: This isn't the first time the U.S. and Israel have disagreed over Gaza
item.description: The U.S. and Israel are close allies, but they've had sharp disagreements. Are the current differences over the war in Gaza a short-term dispute or a fundamental change in the relationship?
item.content:encoded: The U.S. and Israel are close allies, but they've had sharp disagreements. Are the current differences over the war in Gaza a short-term dispute or a fundamental change in the relationship?
item.dc:creator: Greg Myre

item.title: You'll need more than $100,000 in income to afford a typical home, studies show
item.description: Two recent studies suggest that prospective homeowners will have to earn more than $100,000 annually to afford a typical home in much of the U.S.
item.content:encoded:
Two recent studies suggest that prospective homeowners will have to earn more than $100,000 annually to afford a typical home in much of the U.S.

(Image credit: Matt Rourke)
item.dc:creator: Joe Hernandez

item.title: What The Beatles and Beyoncé's 'Blackbird' means to this Little Rock Nine member
item.description: A fan of both The Beatles and Beyoncé, 82-year-old Melba Pattillo Beals says the song is more special to her than ever. She is one of the Black students who helped desegregate U.S. public schools.
item.content:encoded: A fan of both The Beatles and Beyoncé, 82-year-old Melba Pattillo Beals says the song is more special to her than ever. She is one of the Black students who helped desegregate U.S. public schools.
item.dc:creator: Juliana Kim

item.title: Florida adds abortion to November ballot; Iran blames Israel for embassy bombing
item.description: Florida voters will have the chance to enshrine abortion rights into their constitution. Iran blames Israel for an embassy bombing that killed a top military commander.
item.content:encoded:
Florida voters will have the chance to enshrine abortion rights into their constitution. Iran blames Israel for an embassy bombing that killed a top military commander.

(Image credit: Mark Wallheiser)
item.dc:creator: Mansee Khurana

item.title: New ad campaign from Democrats targets vulnerable Republicans over IVF
item.description: The DCCC is placing billboards in eight swing districts where Republicans supported the Life At Conception Act, NPR has exclusively learned.
item.content:encoded: The DCCC is placing billboards in eight swing districts where Republicans supported the Life At Conception Act, NPR has exclusively learned.
item.dc:creator: Lexie Schapitl
